column2: ##boing_boing_candy_2017 data cleaned and pivoted, now with candy and rating in separate columns
# -many mutates on country so left with US, UK, Canada and Other or NA
# -pivot so that candy is in one and rating in another column
"Q6 | Anonymous brown globs that come in black and orange wrappers\t(a.k.a. Mary Janes)"
"Q6 | Candy that is clearly just the stuff given out for free at restaurants"
"Q6 | Cash, or other forms of legal tender"
"Q6 | Chick-o-Sticks (we don’t know what that is)"
"Q6 | Real Housewives of Orange County Season 9 Blue-Ray"
"Q6 | Sandwich-sized bags filled with BooBerry Crunch"
"Q6 | Those odd marshmallow circus peanut things"
"Q6 | Vials of pure high fructose corn syrup, for main-lining into your vein"
mutate(country = str_replace(country, "there isn't one for old men", "US")) %>%
mutate(country = str_replace(country, "The Yoo Ess of Aaayyyyyy", "US")) %>%
mutate(country = str_replace(country, "A tropical island south of the equator", "Other")) %>%
